result.execSummary:
The defendant James Dontrell Pinkin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

**01-25-16/ Judge John Siefert**
The Court ordered that the JOC shall be amended to reflect a TOTAL of 108 days of sentence credit.
Consecutive to: with 108 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

records.addlTxt:
Order Concerning Sentence Adjustment, signed and filed.

THE COURT ORDERS:
The Petition for sentence adjustment is DENIED because it it not in the public interest.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. jbs
Reflects 01-25-16 Court order granting  a total of 108 days of sentence credit.
records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt:
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.

THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is amended to reflect a total of 108 days of sentence credit.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify order for sentence credit.

Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in court with attorney Awni M Yasin.  Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

 Probation having been revoked, sentencing proceeded.  Statements by each counsel and defendant.
  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  TWO YEARS with 166 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is ONE  YEAR AND ONE MONTH; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is  ELEVEN  MONTHS.
TERMS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*NO NEW RETAIL THEFT TICKETS, OR THC POSSESSION
*PAY ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND SURCHARGES  FROM 25% OF PRISON WAGES DUE BY 12-18-17 OR CIVIL JUDGMENT SHALL BE ENTERED AGAINST THE DEFENDANT.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and/or the WI Substance Abuse program. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in court, in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case adjourned for sentencing after revocation in Branch 47. Defendant wishes to have counsel.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Pursuant to current District Court Rules, this case is assigned and 
forwarded to Judge Siefert
for review. os

DOC request to clarify length of probationary period.

Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   Court withheld sentence, but granted defendant credit for 55 days,( to be determined at time of revocation)
time served in the event that sentence is imposed at a later date.  Court placed defendant on probation for TWO YEARS with the following conditions:
*REFERRED TO MENTAL HEALTH UNIT OF PROBATION
*TAKE ALL PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS
*AODA/ANY TREATMENT DEEMED APPROPRIATE
*NO NEW RETAIL THEFT /PAN HANDLING TICKETS
*$650.00 FINE INCLUDING ALL MANDATORY COSTS, FEES AND  DNA SURCHARGES FROM BAIL, RETURN $100.00 TO WHOMEVER POSTED IT.
Appeal rights given to the defendant.

Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Justice point report received and filed. 
  Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Court ordered defendant remanded into custody for sentencing.   Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47. Court vacates jury trial.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Final Pretrial. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47 for Final Pretrial, but will be scheduled as a Plea Hearing so defendant is produced. Per Judge, case calendared on 9/11/2015.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed, Justice Point Report.
Received and Filed, Justice Point VIOLATION Report; New Charges.

08/20/2015
Court ordered case adjourned for  final pretrial on 9-3-15 at 8:30 and jury trial in Branch 47. lr  Jury trial scheduled for 09-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant James Dontrell Pinkin not in court, in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Speedy trial demand.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 08-06-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court, defendant James Dontrell Pinkin not in court, in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion to modify bail argued and DENIED by the Court.  Court increased the Bail: $750.00 cash with tot to Justice point for monitoring if posted. .
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with any and all Target Stores.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision. DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing. No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant James Dontrell Pinkin in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bvj  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
